item.title: Visualizing insect count data — a zero-inflated poisson model
item.description: Most ecologists would agree: it’s really hard to predict which animals are going to be where, and how many of them you might find when you look. Lately, there has been lots of interest in using mixed-effects models to make these predictions. The advantage is that these models are of a kind that most biologists already know about. The disadvantage is that they can be… a little larger than what we’re used…

item.title: Centering by group means, Part I

item.title: Don’t hide your (scientific) weaknesses
item.description: What are your weaknesses as a scientist? What should we do when we become aware of those weaknesses, or when someone makes us aware? item.title: Converting Anxiety into wisdom
item.description: I can be skeptical, even anxious, about ecology – particularly about methods and data quality. However, “anxiety can be cultivated into Wisdom” (McElreath, 2015).
